We came here thinking it was the original La Flauta (close by), but were confused- this is what they have called "La Flauta II". We came in at sat ourselves at around 3:30pm for an afternoon meal at the bar.  Service was quick. We had 3 tapas and a few coffees. Noticed that many people around us came in for a quick meal- a sandwich (4-5€) and a wine. We didn't have any wine but it looked like the people around us enjoyed it.  Everything is priced well, but we thought the food was okay... I'm not even sure I would recommend this place based on what we ate.  We did have the egg/potato concoction. It was fine.  Nothing extravagant.  In fact, I wish we had just a simple sandwich or other tapa item instead.  The coffees we had were delicious, though... Really good stuff and at a good price 1.2€. If we had more time here, I believe I would give it another shot.  The next time, I would just go in for a simple sandwich and coffee.
